steps: Shut down MacBook completely and disconnect all cables
Remove 6 P5 pentalobe screws from bottom case
Use spudger to carefully lift bottom case from rear edge
Disconnect battery connector immediately for safety
Ground yourself with anti-static wrist strap throughout procedure
Identify component requiring repair or replacement
Remove necessary screws and disconnect relevant connectors
Install replacement component following proper orientation
Reconnect all cables and connectors securely
Reconnect battery connector as final internal step
Replace bottom case ensuring proper alignment
Reinstall all 6 pentalobe screws with proper torque
Power on and verify all functionality works correctly
warnings: MANDATORY: Wear anti-static wrist strap throughout entire procedure
Battery must be disconnected before performing any internal work
Internal components are extremely sensitive to electrostatic discharge
Use only Apple-certified replacement parts to maintain warranty
Improper assembly may void warranty and cause permanent damage
Never force connectors - they should connect smoothly
Keep workspace clean and organized to prevent component loss
